scenes.title: Deleting Instagram, gaining focus
scenes.main_point: Removing Instagram freed time and attention for intentional reading.
scenes.scene_summary: After deleting Instagram, I gained time, energy, and attention to read intentionally.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits in a quiet reading space, holding a book with a calm, focused posture.
Their phone screen nearby shows Instagram deleted, implying freed attention for intentional reading.

scenes.title: Curiosity-led reading quota
scenes.main_point: Reading followed curiosity with a simple one-hour daily quota.
scenes.scene_summary: I followed curiosity and hit a one-hour reading quota; anything extra felt like bonus.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
One person at a desk, reading highlighted book pages while a timer is set to 1:00:00.
Notebook with brief notes beside them and a stack of books nearby, calm focus.

scenes.title: Two books and Feynman’s warning
scenes.main_point: Both books pointed to Feynman’s principle about self-deception.
scenes.scene_summary: Two books led me to Feynman’s warning: I was the easiest person to fool.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
A person sits at a desk with two books visible: The Beginning of Infinity and Ego is the Enemy.
They flip a page while a screen nearby displays Richard Feynman’s quote: “You are the easiest person to fool.”

scenes.title: High ego blocks beginner work
scenes.main_point: High ego distorted reality and stopped learning, like avoiding guitar practice.
scenes.scene_summary: High ego made me fear sounding bad on guitar and resist learning from a kid.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
In a simple room, an unused guitar leans against the wall beside a practice exercises sheet.
A child demonstrates chords while an adult stands close, hesitant hands resting on the strings, resisting learning and feeling self-conscious.

scenes.title: Purpose fantasies vs doing what’s needed
scenes.main_point: Chasing grand purpose hid basic neglect; leaders did necessary work without titles.
scenes.scene_summary: I chased world-changing purpose while neglecting basics, but leaders did needed work anyway.
key_elements: to-do list with basics: eat well, exercise
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
One person in a modest home, staring at a to-do list of basics (eat well, exercise) while holding a trash bag and toilet brush.
They begin doing simple chores as faded titles/awards recede behind them, mood: humbled focus.

scenes.title: Low ego, better explanations, real progress
scenes.main_point: Humility and good explanations prevented self-deception and enabled growth after rejection.
scenes.scene_summary: After hackathon rejection, I learned product-building, questioned bad explanations, and progressed with low ego.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Sketched storyboard style, pencil lines, minimal shading.
The protagonist at a desk with a laptop showing a hackathon rejection email, then switching to a no-code tool interface.
Quick cutaway of hackathon teammates collaborating and a simple Galileo heliocentric diagram beside notes, implying humble focus.
Ends with the protagonist holding a “Finalist / 3rd Prize” sign, calm satisfaction.
